TITLE: Biden's manufacturing boom is underway. But the jobs haven't followed yet.
SUMMARY: The new manufacturing jobs tied to Biden’s investment plans are coming — but maybe not until after the election.

TITLE: White House seizes on positive economic message
Biden’s new economic messaging strategy: attack Trump’s tax legacy
SUMMARY: The strategy shift focuses on Trump’s tax law and poses a simple question to voters: Whose side are you on?

TITLE: US employers added surprisingly robust 353,000 jobs in January in further sign of economic strength
SUMMARY: The unemployment rate stayed at 3.7%, just above a half-century low.

TITLE: Biden’s economy keeps messing up Trump’s message
SUMMARY: “You can’t blame the president when policies go wrong, and then say he’s not responsible if things are going right.”

TITLE: Liberals Dreamed of This Economy For Decades. What If Voters Don’t Like It?
SUMMARY: Policymakers were determined to avoid the mistakes of the Great Recession — and they succeeded. But now they are in a mood of “fear and introspection.”

TITLE: US employers add a surprisingly strong 275,000 jobs in sign of continued economic strength
SUMMARY: Last month’s job growth was up from a revised gain of 229,000 jobs in January.

TITLE: The toughest pain points awaiting Biden at the State of the Union
SUMMARY: The president’s team thinks it's had a historically successful first term, delivering victories on the economy, climate, drug pricing and more. But many Americans aren’t feeling it.

TITLE: ‘The last mile is harder’: Stubborn inflation stalls rate cuts
SUMMARY: The concern is that higher rates are putting pressure on households and businesses looking to borrow, weighing on hiring, investment and the housing market.

TITLE: US employers added a surprisingly robust 303,000 jobs in March in a sign of economic strength
SUMMARY: By any measure, it amounted to a strong month of hiring.

TITLE: Trump Is Misleading You With Covid-Era Statistics. So Is Biden.
SUMMARY: Biden and Trump are both campaigning on warped economic statistics, cherry-picking weird data from the Covid crisis.

TITLE: US job market slows in April
SUMMARY: Friday’s government report showed that last month’s hiring gain was down sharply from the blockbuster increase of 315,000 in March.
